definition: to die in the line of duty
to be buried with the dead/to die for a cause
to die as in the line of duty (idiom)

sentences.english: Whether our lovable party did die in line of duty this professor locates the martyr?
sentences.chinese: 我們可愛的黨是否把這位因公殉職的教授定位烈士呢？

sentences.english: He died on the job while repairing a streetlamp.
sentences.chinese: 他在修路燈時因公殉職。

sentences.english: He was killed in the line of duty last year.
sentences.chinese: 他去年在執行公務時殉職。

sentences.english: South Korea's president has paid tribute to 46 sailors killed last month when a warship exploded and sank near the disputed sea-border with North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 韓國總統已經弔唁46名殉職的船員在上個月。

sentences.english: Britain says 179 of its troops have died in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 英國說，179名將士在伊拉克戰爭中殉職。

sentences.english: They were not surprised that he died in the line of duty.
sentences.chinese: 對於他在自己崗位上殉職，他們並不喫驚。

sentences.english: More than 800 officers were killed in the line of duty last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年一年有超過800名警察因公殉職。

sentences.english: I remember the day his partner, his best friend was gone down in the line of duty.
sentences.chinese: 他的同伴，同樣也是他最好的朋友因公殉職。

sentences.english: Last year, Google arrived in Beidaihe, then it down to Beijing. Unfortunately, working in Beijing later died in harness.
sentences.chinese: 去年春上到北戴河，後來到北京工作，不幸以身殉職。

definition: to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
Zeppelin (name)/Graf Ferdinand von Zeppelin (1838-1917), inventor of the Zeppelin dirigible airship
to shoot dead (with a gun, or bow and arrow)
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
